paper_abstract: In this paper the analysis of the data structures used in a symbolic computation system, called Kenzo, is undertaken. We deal with the specification of the inheritance relationship since Kenzo is an object-oriented system, written in CLOS, the Common Lisp Object System. We show how the order-sorted algebraic specification formalism can be adapted, through the "inheritance as coercion" metaphor, in order to model the simple inheritance between structures in Kenzo.
paper_title: Modeling inheritance as coercion in the Kenzo system
